alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 5:50AM EDT until May 28 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Water has been reported over the road in places between Madawaska and St. Francis. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since midnight with an additional 0.5 inches expected this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Frenchville, New Canada, Dickey, Allagash Township, Cross Lake, Wallagrass, Saint John, Saint Francis, Soldier Pond, Daigle and Saint Agatha. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
